model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Co-workers A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: Hey, I just wanted to share some exciting news with you. I was promoted to product manager!
Co-workers B: Really? Congrats! That's a big step up from your previous role.
Co-workers A: Yeah, I'm feeling a mix of excitement and nervousness. It's a lot of responsibility, but I'm ready for the challenge.
Co-workers B: I have no doubt that you'll do great. You've always been a strong leader and have a great eye for detail.
Co-workers A: Thanks, that means a lot. I'm looking forward to working with the design team and coming up with some innovative new products.
Co-workers B: Speaking of new products, remember when you used to fantasize about being a great leader?
Co-workers A: Ha, yeah. That seems like ages ago.
Co-workers B: Well, now you can finally take on that leadership role and make your dreams a reality.

[MEMORY]
Co-worker B encourages Co-worker A to consider pursuing a leadership position and highlights the qualities of a good leader.
Co-worker A considers taking on more responsibility at work as a start towards being a leader.
Co-worker A has fantasies of being a great leader and emphasizes the importance of communication.

prediction:
Brief explanation: The memory contains information about Co-worker A's past interest in taking on a leadership role and about the qualities they believe a good leader should have. It may serve as a good reference point to recall their aspiration and idealized vision of leadership in their new role as a product manager. 

Judgement: "Yes"
